x_nuta2_nutanix_ca_nutanix_marketplaceit.author: Nutanix
x_nuta2_nutanix_ca_nutanix_marketplaceit.description:
Kubernetes is an open-source platform for automating deployment, scaling, and operations of application containers across clusters of hosts, providing container-centric infrastructure.

License:
  • Apache License 2.0
Hardware Requirement:
  • By default, three master VMs each 2 vCPU, 2GB RAM and three workers 4 vCPU, 4GB RAM
  • OS Disk 8GB, Master - Data Disks 6 x 10GB, Worker - Data Disks 3 x 10GB.
Resources Installed:
  • Etcd version v3.3.12
  • Kubernetes 1.12.x to 1.18.x
  • Supported Network plugins: Flannel (Default), Canal, Calico
  • Docker versions: 17.12.1.ce, 18.03.1.ce, 18.06.3.ce, 18.09.9, 19.03.8 (default) (Please check release notes for validated docker versions.)
Operating System:
  • CentOS Linux release 7.8.2003
  • Select the AMI on AWS.
  • Select the Image on GCP.
  • Select the Image according to the location on Azure.
Platform:
  • AHV
  • AWS
  • GCP
  • Azure
  • VMware
Lifecycle:
  • ScaleOut
  • ScaleIn
  • Upgrade
Limitations:
  • User containers will be scheduled only on Workers.
  • A unique Service IP Subnet has to be used while deploying blueprint, and the subnet has to be routable to any one of the workers within your network.
  • Canal & Calico network plugin are officially supported with kubernetes version 1.10, 1.11, 1.12.
  • Self signed certificates are created during deployment. User cannot create certificates.
x_nuta2_nutanix_ca_nutanix_marketplaceit.description_markdown: Kubernetes is an open-source platform for automating deployment, scaling, and operations of application containers across clusters of hosts, providing container-centric infrastructure. #### License: * Apache License 2.0 #### Hardware Requirement: * By default, three master VMs each 2 vCPU, 2GB RAM and three workers 4 vCPU, 4GB RAM * OS Disk 8GB, Master - Data Disks 6 x 10GB, Worker - Data Disks 3 x 10GB. #### Resources Installed: * Etcd version v3.3.12 * Kubernetes 1.12.x to 1.18.x * Supported Network plugins: Flannel (Default), Canal, Calico * Docker versions: 17.12.1.ce, 18.03.1.ce, 18.06.3.ce, 18.09.9, 19.03.8 (default) (Please check release notes for validated docker versions.) #### Operating System: * CentOS Linux release 7.8.2003 * Select the [AMI](https://goo.gl/td2eJJ) on AWS. * Select the [Image](https://goo.gl/51oD7D) on GCP. * Select the [Image](https://bit.ly/3c7sr9i) according to the location on Azure. #### Platform: * AHV * AWS * GCP * Azure * VMware #### Lifecycle: * ScaleOut * ScaleIn * Upgrade #### Limitations: * User containers will be scheduled only on Workers. * A unique Service IP Subnet has to be used while deploying blueprint, and the subnet has to be routable to any one of the workers within your network. * Canal & Calico network plugin are officially supported with kubernetes version 1.10, 1.11, 1.12. * Self signed certificates are created during deployment. User cannot create certificates.
x_nuta2_nutanix_ca_nutanix_marketplaceit.name: Kubernetes
